intro: Stylodon carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Stylodon carolinensis is an important part of the ecological community, providing food for various insects and birds.
